trans-unit.source: Represents the abstract base class from which the classes <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey"></xref> derive.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType> class represents the abstract base class from which the classes <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> derive.
These two classes contain the actual encrypted data or key information in XML encryption.
To comply with XML encryption standards, you should use these two derived classes.
For more information on XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> class.
This constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType> class.
This class represents the abstract base class from which the classes <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> derive.
To comply with XML encryption standards, you should use the two derived classes.
For more information on XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.
Adds an `<EncryptionProperty>` child element to the `<EncryptedProperties>` element in the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> object in XML encryption.
This method can be used to add `<EncryptionProperty>` child elements to the `<EncryptedProperties>` element.
The `<EncryptedProperties>` element provides additional information for the `<EncryptedType>` element.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptionProperty"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData"></xref> value for an instance of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> class.
The `<CipherData>` element is a required element in XML encryption that provides the encrypted data.

It must either contain the encrypted octet sequence as the base64-encoded text of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property, or provide a reference to an external location containing the encrypted octet sequence using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherReference%2A> property.
For more information about this element, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType.CipherData"></xref> property was set to `null`.
Gets or sets the `Encoding` attribute of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> instance in XML encryption.
This property describes the encoding of the encrypted data.
For example, if the encrypted data is a base64-encoded PNG, the encoding could be specified as 'http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#base64'.
A string that describes the encoding of the encrypted data.
Gets or sets the `<EncryptionMethod>` element for XML encryption.
The `<EncryptionMethod>` is an optional element that describes the encryption algorithm applied to the encrypted data.
If the element is absent, the encryption algorithm must be known by the recipient or decryption will fail.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptionMethod"></xref> object that represents the `<EncryptionMethod>` element.
Gets or sets the `<EncryptionProperties>` element in XML encryption.

The `<EncryptionProperties>` element can contain additional information about the creation of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType> instance, such as a date and time stamp or the serial number of cryptographic hardware used during encryption.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptionPropertyCollection"></xref> object.
Returns the XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> object.
Use this method to output the `<EncryptedType>` element in XML.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object that represents the `<EncryptedType>` element in XML encryption.
Gets or sets the `Id` attribute of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> instance in XML encryption.
The `Id` attribute is an optional attribute of the `<EncryptedType>` element that provides a standard method for assigning a string identifier to an element within an XML document.
A string of the `Id` attribute of the `<EncryptedType>` element.
Gets of sets the `<KeyInfo>` element in XML encryption.
The `<KeyInfo>` element is an optional element that contains information about the key used to encrypt the data.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo"></xref> object.
Loads XML information into the `<EncryptedType>` element in XML encryption.
Use this method to load an existing XML element into the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType> object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object representing an XML element to use in the `<EncryptedType>` element.
The value provided is `null`.
Gets or sets the `MimeType` attribute of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> instance in XML encryption.
The `MimeType` attribute is an optional attribute that describes the media type of the encrypted data.

The value of this attribute is a string with values defined by [RFC 2045: Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2045.txt).
For example, if the data that is encrypted is a base64-encoded PNG, the `Encoding` attribute would be 'http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#base64' and the `MimeType` would be 'image/png'.
This attribute is optional and no validation of the `MimeType` information is required.
The attribute does not indicate that the encryption application must do any additional processing.
Note that this information may not be necessary if it is already bound to the identifier in the `Type` attribute.
A string that describes the media type of the encrypted data.
Gets or sets the `Type` attribute of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType"></xref> instance in XML encryption.
The `Type` attribute is an optional attribute that identifies type information about the text form of the encrypted content.

While optional, this is an important attribute and is used in mandatory processing described in [Processing Rules: Decryption](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/) (section 4.2) of the XML Encryption Syntax and Processing specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/).
If the `<EncryptedData>` element contains data of type `'element'` or element `'content'`, and replaces that data in an XML document, it is strongly recommended that the `Type` attribute be provided.
Without this information, the application attempting to decrypt the information will be unable to automatically restore the XML document to its original text form.
A string that describes the text form of the encrypted data.
